00001 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00002 //#include "MagStep.h"
00003 
00004 #define JUMP_METHOD     0
00005 
00006 #define USE_SIX_POINT   0
00007 #define USE_FOUR_POINT  1
00008 #define USE_TWO_POINT   2
00009 
00010 #define DIFF_SCHEME     USE_TWO_POINT
00011

00015 
00016 /*
00017  *   This routine evaluates the "integral invariant, I" from mirror point to
00018  *   mirror point. Instead of tracing the whole field line, this version allows
00019  *   the Quadpack integration routine to evaluate B(s). The hope is that this
00020  *   will decrease the amount of tracing needed to evaluate the integral. It may
00021  *   very well be slower than tracing the whole line and then doing the integral,
00022  *   but we'll try this for comparison ... The other obvious way to do it is to
00023  *   pre-trace the FL and then interpolate the points in some manner. I'm hoping
00024  *   that combining dqags and Bulirsch-Stoer (which are both extrapolation methods)
00025  *   that we'll get a speedup.
00026  *   
00027  *   The integral is as follows:
00028  *
00029  *
00030  *                          / sm_north       
00031  *                         |                 [                ] (1/2)
00032  *                         |                 [        B(s)    ]
00033  *                 I  =    |                 [ 1 -  --------  ]     ds
00034  *                         |                 [         Bm     ]
00035  *                         |                 [                ]
00036  *                        / sm_south
00037  *                       
00038  *
00039  *  I think these are now all reentrant.
00040  *
00041  */
00042 double Iinv( Lgm_MagModelInfo *fInfo ) {
00043 
00044 
00045     double  a, b;
00046     double  epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr;
00047     double  resabs, resasc;
00048     int     key, neval, ier, limit, lenw, last, iwork[501];
00049     double  work[2001];
00050     _qpInfo *qpInfo;
00051 
00052 
00053     /*
00054      *  Type-cast our data structure to a generic type.
00055      *  The structure holds auzilliary info we need down 
00056      *  in the function calls.
00057      */
00058     qpInfo = (_qpInfo *)fInfo;
00059 
00060 
00061 
00062     /*
00063      *  Limits of integration.
00064      */
00065     a = fInfo->Sm_South;
00066     b = fInfo->Sm_North;
00067 
00068 
00069     /*
00070      *   set tolerances. 
00071      */
00072     //epsabs = fInfo->epsabs;
00073     //epsrel = fInfo->epsrel;
00074     epsabs = fInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs;
00075     epsrel = fInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel;
00076 
00077 
00078     /*
00079      *  Init some vars used in I_integrand() (these are not declared static in
00080      *  I_integrand() in order to avoid making it non-reentrant).
00081      */
00082     fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_S         = 0.0;
00083     fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_FirstCall = TRUE;
00084     fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls    = 0;
00085 
00086                                                                                                                                                                              
00087 
00088 
00089     if ( fInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator == DQAGS ) {
00090 
00091         /*
00092          *  Use DQAGS
00093          */
00094         limit = 500; lenw = 4*limit; key = 6;
00095         dqags(I_integrand, qpInfo, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, &result, &abserr, &neval, &ier, limit, lenw, &last, iwork, work);
00096 
00097     } else if ( fInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator == DQK21 ) {
00098 
00099         /*
00100          *  Use DQK21
00101          */
00102         dqk21(I_integrand, qpInfo, a, b, &result, &abserr, &resabs, &resasc);
00103 
00104     } else {
00105 
00106         /*
00107          *  Unknown Integrator
00108          */
00109         printf("Iinv: Unknown integrator. Lgm_Inv_Integrator = %d\n", fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls );
00110         result = -9e99;
00111 
00112     }
00113 
00114 
00115     return( result );
00116 
00117 }

00119 double Iinv_interped( Lgm_MagModelInfo *fInfo ) {
00120 
00121     double  a, b;
00122     double  epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr, resabs, resasc;
00123     int     key, limit, lenw;
00124     int     iwork[501], last, ier, neval;
00125     double  work[2001];
00126     _qpInfo *qpInfo;
00127 
00128 
00129     /*
00130      *  Type-cast our data structure to a generic type.
00131      *  The structure holds auzilliary info we need down 
00132      *  in the function calls.
00133      */
00134     qpInfo = (_qpInfo *)fInfo;
00135 
00136     /*
00137      *  Limits of integration.
00138      */
00139     a = fInfo->Sm_South;
00140     b = fInfo->Sm_North;
00141 
00142     /*
00143      *   set tolerances for QuadPack routines. 
00144      */
00145     //epsabs = fInfo->epsabs;
00146     //epsrel = fInfo->epsrel;
00147     epsabs = fInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsabs;
00148     epsrel = fInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator_epsrel;
00149 
00150 
00151     /*
00152      *  Init some vars used in I_integrand_interped() (these are not declared static in
00153      *  I_integrand() in order to avoid making it non-reentrant).
00154      */
00155     fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls  = 0;
00156 
00157 
00158 
00159     if ( fInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator == DQAGS ) {
00160 
00161         /*
00162          *  Use DQAGS
00163          */
00164         limit = 500; lenw = 4*limit; key = 6;
00165         dqags(I_integrand_interped, qpInfo, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, &result, &abserr, &neval, &ier, limit, lenw, &last, iwork, work);
00166 
00167     } else if ( fInfo->Lgm_I_Integrator == DQK21 ) {
00168 
00169         /*
00170          *  Use DQAGS
00171          */
00172         dqk21(I_integrand_interped, qpInfo, a, b, &result, &abserr, &resabs, &resasc);
00173 
00174     } else {
00175 
00176         /*
00177          *  Unknown Integrator
00178          */
00179         printf("Iinv_interped: Unknown integrator. Lgm_I_Integrator = %d\n", fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls );
00180         result = -9e99;
00181 
00182     }
00183 
00184     return( result );
00185 
00186 }

00188 
00189 double I_integrand_interped( double s, _qpInfo *qpInfo ) {
00190 
00191     double              B, g, f;
00192     Lgm_MagModelInfo    *fInfo;
00193 
00194     /*
00195      *  Get pointer to our auxilliary data structure.
00196      */
00197     fInfo = (Lgm_MagModelInfo *)qpInfo;
00198 
00199     B = BofS( s, fInfo );
00200     g = 1.0 - B/fInfo->Bm;
00201     f = (g > 0.0) ? sqrt( g ) : 0.0;
00202     ++fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls;
00203 
00204     return( f );
00205 
00206 }
00207 
00208 
00209 
00210 
00211 /*
00212  *  Note: The variables that save our state in this (and other fundtions) are
00213  *  not local static variables, but are contained in the Lgm_MagModelInfo
00214  *  structure that the user passes to it. This allows the function to be
00215  *  thread-safe and re-entrant. 
00216  */
00217 double I_integrand( double s, _qpInfo *qpInfo ) {
00218 
00219 
00220     Lgm_Vector          Bvec;
00221     int                 reset=1, done, Count;
00222     double              f, g, Hremaining, Hdone, H, Htry, Hdid, Hnext, sgn=1.0, sdid, B, dS;
00223     Lgm_MagModelInfo    *fInfo;
00224 
00225 
00226 
00227     /*
00228      *  Get pointer to our auxilliary data structure.
00229      */
00230     fInfo = (Lgm_MagModelInfo *)qpInfo;
00231 
00232     fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_u_scale.x =  10.0;  fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_u_scale.y = 1.0; fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_u_scale.z = 10.0;
00233 
00234 
00235 
00236     if ( fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_JumpMethod == LGM_RELATIVE_JUMP_METHOD ) {
00237 
00238         /*
00239          *  Set starting point.  If this is the first call for this integral,
00240          *  set point to the lower limit. 
00241          */
00242         if ( fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_FirstCall  == TRUE ) {
00243             fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_FirstCall = FALSE;
00244             fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_P = fInfo->Pm_South;
00245             fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_S = 0.0;
00246             dS = s;
00247         } else {
00248             dS = s - fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_S;
00249         }
00250 
00251         if (dS < 0.0) {
00252             H = -dS; sgn = -1.0; // H is a positive qnty
00253         } else {
00254             H = dS; sgn = 1.0;
00255         }
00256 
00257     } else if ( fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_JumpMethod == LGM_ABSOLUTE_JUMP_METHOD ) {
00258 
00259         /*
00260          *  This strategy starts at start each time.  Slower(?), but seems to
00261          *  limit roundoff error from accumulating? The speed increase of the
00262          *  relative method really depends on how far apart the s points are
00263          *  that the integrator is picking. If they are bouncing all over the
00264          *  place the relative method still does alot of tracing.
00265          */
00266         if ( fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_FirstCall == TRUE ) {
00267             fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_FirstCall = FALSE;
00268         } 
00269         fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_P = fInfo->Pm_South;
00270         fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_S = 0.0;
00271         H = s; sgn = 1.0; // H is a positive qnty
00272  
00273     } else {
00274 
00275         printf("I_integrand: Error, unknown Jump Method ( Lgm_I_integrand_JumpMethod = %d\n", fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_JumpMethod );
00276         exit(-1);
00277 
00278     }
00279 
00280 
00281     /*
00282      *  Get B-field at the given value of s.  Need to advance along field line
00283      *  by an amount H. May need to do more than one call to get there...
00284      *  Setting Htry to be H is an attempt to make the full jump in one call to
00285      *  MagStep. For very precise calculations, the number of jumps we do here
00286      *  seems to be fairly critical. Making two jumps (i.e. Htry = H/2) and
00287      *  limiting Hmax to 0.5 Re seems to work pretty well (perhaps its because
00288      *  symetry between mirror points?). Could still play with the max step
00289      *  size of 0.5 -- maybe something a bit higher would work just as well and
00290      *  be more efficient?
00291      */
00292     done = FALSE; Count = 0; Htry = 0.5*H; Hdone = 0.0; reset = TRUE;
00293     if (Htry > 0.5) Htry = 0.5;
00294     if ( fabs(fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_S-s) < 1e-12 ) done = TRUE;
00295 
00296     while ( !done ) {
00297 
00298         Lgm_MagStep( &fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_P, &fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &sdid, &reset, fInfo->Bfield, fInfo );
00299         Hdone += Hdid; // positive qnty
00300 
00301         fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_S += sgn*Hdid;
00302         Hremaining = H - Hdone;
00303         if ( Count > 1000 ) {
00304             printf("I_integrand: Warning, early return because Count > 1000. Ill-conditioned integrand?\n");
00305             done = TRUE;
00306         } else if ( fabs(fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_S-s) < 1e-12 ){
00307             done = TRUE;
00308         } else {
00309             if ( Htry > Hremaining ) Htry = Hremaining;
00310         }
00311         ++Count;
00312     }
00313 
00314     fInfo->Bfield( &fInfo->Lgm_I_integrand_P, &Bvec, fInfo );
00315     B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00316 
00317     /*
00318      * Compute integrand, ( 1 - B/Bm ) ^ (1/2) Make sure 1-B/Bm is not
00319      * negative. If it is, assume its zero. (Note that sometimes (due to
00320      * round-off error) it could be very slightly negative).
00321      */
00322     g = 1.0 - B/fInfo->Bm;
00323     f = (g > 0.0) ? sqrt( g ) : 0.0;
00324 
00325     ++fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls;
00326 
00327     return( f );
00328 
00329 }
00330

00333 /*
00334  *  Compute Gradient of I
00335  */
00336 int Grad_I( Lgm_Vector *v0, Lgm_Vector *GradI, Lgm_MagModelInfo *fInfo ) {
00337 
00338     Lgm_Vector  u, Pa, Pb;
00339     double  H, h, a, b, Sa, Sb, I, f[6];
00340     int     i, N;
00341     
00342 
00343 
00344     /*
00345      * We want to compute the gradient of I at the point v0.
00346      * This requires 3 derivatives: one each in x, y and z directions.
00347      * We will try a fairly acurate difference scehme:
00348      *
00349      *      f_0^(1) = 1/(60h)  ( f_3 - 9f_2 + 45f_1  - 45f_-1 + 9f_-2 - f_-3 )
00350      * See page 450 of CRC standard Math tables 28th edition.
00351      */
00352 
00353 
00354     /*
00355      *  Set h to a smallish value
00356      */
00357     h = 5e-2;
00358 
00359 
00360     switch ( DIFF_SCHEME ) {
00361         case USE_SIX_POINT:
00362             N = 3;
00363             break;
00364         case USE_FOUR_POINT:
00365             N = 2;
00366             break;
00367         case USE_TWO_POINT:
00368             N = 1;
00369             break;
00370     }
00371 
00372 
00373     // User should set these?
00374     //fInfo->epsabs = 0.0;
00375     //fInfo->epsrel = 1e-3;
00376 
00377     
00378     /* X-component */
00379     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) printf("\t\tComputing dIdx: h = %g\n", h);
00380     for (i=-N; i<=N; ++i){
00381 
00382         if (i!=0) { // dont need the center value in our difference scheme
00383     
00384             u = *v0; H = (double)i*h; u.x += H;
00385 
00386             /*
00387              * Trace to northern mirror point
00388              */
00389             printf("A. Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint\n");
00390             if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &u, &Pb, &Sb, 120.0, fInfo->Bm, 1.0, fInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, fInfo ) > 0 ) {
00391 
00392                 /*
00393                  * Trace to southern mirror point
00394                  */
00395                 printf("B. Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint\n");
00396                 if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &u, &Pa, &Sa, 120.0, fInfo->Bm, -1.0, fInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, fInfo ) > 0 ) {
00397 
00398                     a = 0.0; b = Sa+Sb;
00399                     fInfo->Pm_South = Pa; fInfo->Sm_South = a;
00400                     fInfo->Pm_North = Pb; fInfo->Sm_North = b;
00401                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\tComputing Integral Invariant. Limits of integration are: [a,b] = [%g,%g]\n", a, b);
00402 
00403                     fInfo->FirstCall = TRUE;
00404                     fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls = 0;
00405                     I = Iinv( fInfo );
00406                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\tI = %g   ", I);
00407                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls = %d\n", fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls );
00408 
00409 
00410                 } else {
00411                     printf("\t\tMirror point below 120km in Southern Hemisphere\n");
00412                     exit(0);
00413                 }
00414 
00415             } else {
00416                 printf("\t\tMirror point below 120km in Northern Hemisphere\n");
00417                 exit(0);
00418             }
00419 
00420 
00421             f[i+N] = I;
00422 
00423         }
00424 
00425     }
00426     if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_SIX_POINT){
00427         GradI->x = (f[6] - 9.0*f[5] + 45.0*f[4] - 45.0*f[2] + 9.0*f[1] - f[0])/(60.0*h);
00428     } else if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_FOUR_POINT){
00429         GradI->x = (-f[4] + 8.0*f[3] - 8.0*f[1] + f[0])/(12.0*h);
00430     } else if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_TWO_POINT){
00431         GradI->x = (f[2] - f[0])/(2.0*h);
00432     }
00433     
00434     
00435 
00436     /* Y-component */
00437     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) printf("\t\tComputing dIdy: h = %g\n", h);
00438     for (i=-N; i<=N; ++i){
00439 
00440         if (i!=0) { // dont need the center value in our difference scheme
00441     
00442             u = *v0; H = (double)i*h; u.y += H;
00443 
00444             /*
00445              * Trace to northern mirror point
00446              */
00447             printf("C. Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint\n");
00448             if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &u, &Pb, &Sb, 120.0, fInfo->Bm, 1.0, fInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, fInfo ) > 0 ) {
00449 
00450                 /*
00451                  * Trace to southern mirror point
00452                  */
00453                 printf("D. Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint\n");
00454                 if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &u, &Pa, &Sa, 120.0, fInfo->Bm, -1.0, fInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, fInfo ) > 0 ) {
00455 
00456                     a = 0.0; b = Sa+Sb;
00457                     fInfo->Pm_South = Pa; fInfo->Sm_South = a;
00458                     fInfo->Pm_North = Pb; fInfo->Sm_North = b;
00459                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\tComputing Integral Invariant. Limits of integration are: [a,b] = [%g,%g]\n", a, b);
00460 
00461                     fInfo->FirstCall = TRUE;
00462                     fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls = 0;
00463                     I = Iinv( fInfo );
00464                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\tI = %g   ", I);
00465                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls = %d\n", fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls );
00466 
00467 
00468                 } else {
00469                     printf("\t\tMirror point below 120km in Southern Hemisphere\n");
00470                     exit(0);
00471                 }
00472 
00473             } else {
00474                 printf("\t\tMirror point below 120km in Northern Hemisphere\n");
00475                 exit(0);
00476             }
00477 
00478 
00479             f[i+N] = I;
00480 
00481         }
00482 
00483     }
00484     if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_SIX_POINT){
00485         GradI->y = (f[6] - 9.0*f[5] + 45.0*f[4] - 45.0*f[2] + 9.0*f[1] - f[0])/(60.0*h);
00486     } else if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_FOUR_POINT){
00487         GradI->y = (-f[4] + 8.0*f[3] - 8.0*f[1] + f[0])/(12.0*h);
00488     } else if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_TWO_POINT){
00489         GradI->y = (f[2] - f[0])/(2.0*h);
00490     }
00491 
00492 
00493     /* Z-component */
00494     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 0) printf("\t\tComputing dIdz: h = %g\n", h);
00495     for (i=-N; i<=N; ++i){
00496 
00497         if (i!=0) { // dont need the center value in our difference scheme
00498     
00499             u = *v0; H = (double)i*h; u.z += H;
00500 
00501             /*
00502              * Trace to northern mirror point
00503              */
00504             printf("E. Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint\n");
00505             if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &u, &Pb, &Sb, 120.0, fInfo->Bm, 1.0, fInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, fInfo ) > 0 ) {
00506 
00507                 /*
00508                  * Trace to southern mirror point
00509                  */
00510                 printf("F. Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint\n");
00511                 if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &u, &Pa, &Sa, 120.0, fInfo->Bm, -1.0, fInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, fInfo ) > 0 ) {
00512 
00513                     a = 0.0; b = Sa+Sb;
00514                     fInfo->Pm_South = Pa; fInfo->Sm_South = a;
00515                     fInfo->Pm_North = Pb; fInfo->Sm_North = b;
00516                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\tComputing Integral Invariant. Limits of integration are: [a,b] = [%g,%g]\n", a, b);
00517 
00518                     fInfo->FirstCall = TRUE;
00519                     fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls = 0;
00520                     I = Iinv( fInfo );
00521                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("\t\tI = %g   ", I);
00522                     if (fInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls = %d\n", fInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls );
00523 
00524 
00525                 } else {
00526                     printf("\t\tMirror point below 120km in Southern Hemisphere\n");
00527                     exit(0);
00528                 }
00529 
00530             } else {
00531                 printf("\t\tMirror point below 120km in Northern Hemisphere\n");
00532                 exit(0);
00533             }
00534 
00535 
00536             f[i+N] = I;
00537 
00538         }
00539 
00540     }
00541     if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_SIX_POINT){
00542         GradI->z = (f[6] - 9.0*f[5] + 45.0*f[4] - 45.0*f[2] + 9.0*f[1] - f[0])/(60.0*h);
00543     } else if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_FOUR_POINT){
00544         GradI->z = (-f[4] + 8.0*f[3] - 8.0*f[1] + f[0])/(12.0*h);
00545     } else if (DIFF_SCHEME == USE_TWO_POINT){
00546         GradI->z = (f[2] - f[0])/(2.0*h);
00547     }
00548 
00549     printf("\t\tGrad_I = %g %g %g\n", GradI->x, GradI->y, GradI->z);
00550 
00551     return(0);
00552 
00553 }
